upon any street highway road or roadway or any other place or area open to the public during the hours to which the use thereof by such unattended minor is prohibited hereunder such minor shall have in his or her possession a note or message in writing signed by his or her parent guardian or duly authorized and appointed custodian stating the nature of the errand the necessity therefor the place or designation at which the mission is to be accomplished the time such message was executed and the approximate time required for the errand any abuse of the purpose or spirit of this section shall constitute a violation of the provisions of this chapter punishable as hereinafter provided 3   enforcement a enforcement officials every member of the police department of the township and all other officials charged with law enforcement within the township are authorized and directed to enforce the provisions of this chapter and it shall be a part of their official duty and the obligation to the mayor and township committee and the public at large to follow the directives prescribed in subsections a and b of this section b protective custody the first duty upon the apprehending officer or official shall be to take the minor into protective custody he or she shall then make a complete record of the circumstances under which the minor was first seen and discovered in violation of the purposes of this chapter and such record shall include the name and address of such minor the names and addresses of all persons who have either legal or moral responsibility for the minors well being and the category of responsibility such as parent guardian or custodian upon completion of the record of all salient facts available the apprehending officer or official shall either order the minor to return to his or her home or place of residence forthwith or personally accompany the minor to his or her home depending upon all the facts and circumstances of the case in all cases the apprehending official shall report the facts within twentyfour 24 hours to the chief of police of the township who in turn shall cause all pertinent allegations facts and circumstances to be recorded in a permanent record c formal notice upon receipt of the report required in the preceding subsection it shall be the duty of the chief of police to serve a formal notice upon all persons whose names appear in the report of the apprehending officer or official or in any inquiry made as a result of such report who have legal and moral responsibility for the well being of the minor involved that there has been a violation of this chapter the notice prescribed shall be captioned notice of first violation of curfew  and shall contain all pertinent facts in any given case such notice may be served personally by any member of the police department or mailed by registered or certified mail with return receipt requested for the purposes of this chapter such notice when duly produced and admitted as evidence in the municipal court of the township shall constitute a basis for proceeding with a trial in which the second or subsequent violation hereof is the offense charged d summonsconviction upon the second or subsequent violation of the provisions of this chapter by either a minor under the age of eighteen 18 years or by any parent legal guardian or otherwise duly authorized and accredited custodian having lawful care custody and control of the minor the chief of police of the township shall cause an approximate summons to be issued calling for the municipal court appearance of the minor and all persons who have a legal and moral responsibility for the care custody and control of such minor any person in any of the categories specified in subsection a of this section shall upon conviction of any violation of this chapter in the municipal court of the township be subject to a fine of not more than one thousand dollars $100000 or by community service not to exceed ninety 90 days or by both fine and community service   prior code  364   definitions as used in this chapter apprehending officer means the person or official who was first informed of committee definitions youth sports team as used herein shall refer to any sports organization organized pursuant to a nonprofit or similar charter which is affiliated with or received monetary or other support from east greenwich township or the east greenwich township parks and recreational committee or regularly utilizes any facilities owned operated or maintained by east greenwich township which sports organization participates in sporting competitions involving minors part   regulations a the code of conduct committee shall be made up of the president of each youth sports team who is duly elected pursuant to the bylaws or rules and regulations governing each respective youth sports team b each youth sports team shall annually advise in writing the east greenwich township clerk of the name address and telephone number of its duly elected president who shall serve on the code of conduct committee commensurate with hisher term of office with the youth sports team c each youth sports team shall notify the township clerk in writing promptly upon any change of the identity of the youth sports teams president d any youth sports team president serving on the code of conduct committee may designate an active member of such youth sports team to appear and act as hisher designee with full voting powers at any meeting of the code of conduct committee e in the event the same person is the president of more than one youth sports team said person shall serve on the code of conduct committee as a representative of only one youth sports team and shall designate an active member of such other youth sports teams to appear and act at a code of conduct committee meeting with full voting powers f the code of conduct committee shall be charged with enforcing the provisions of gthe code of conduct committee shall meet in january of each year to elect a chairman secretary and such other officers as the code of conduct committee shall deem appropriate and may meet as often as is necessary to conduct its business and for the purposes of enforcing the provisions of hthe code of conduct committee shall consider complaints alleging a violation of the youth sports code of conduct  the committee shall hold hearings and impose sanctions as authorized upon finding a violation in fact occurred the committee may also decide that a complaint is frivolous and dismiss it outright without a hearing the committee also shall be authorized to refer the matter to the east greenwich township police department i the code of conduct committee may establish rules and procedures as it deems appropriate for the conduct of its business and in default thereof shall operate pursuant to roberts rules of order to the extent they are not in conflict with part youth sports code of conduct definitions conduct means a written specification of the behavior of parents guardians coaches and officials prepared by each sports team which must at a minimum incorporate the within ordinance and must be agreed to in writing by the parents and legal guardians of the minor participants of each youth sports team youth sports event means any competition practice or instructional event involving one or more youth sports teams youth sports team as used herein shall refer to any sports organization organized pursuant to a nonprofit or similar charter which is affiliated with or received monetary or other support from east greenwich township or the east greenwich township parks and recreation committee or regularly utilizes any facilities owned operated or maintained by east greenwich township which sports organization participates in sporting competitions involving minors part   implementation a every sports team shall be required to establish an athletic code of conduct by incorporating this chapter within their bylaws b the parents and guardians of each child participating in a sports team shall be required by the sports team to execute an agreement acknowledging receipt of said sports teams code of conduct and agreeing to be bound thereby part   untolerated behavior and penalties a any parent guest spectator coach or official at any youth sports event who initiates a fight scuffle or any type of verbal or physical abuse or threats of abuse towards any player coach official parents or spectator shall be banned from attendance at all youth sports events within the township of east greenwich for a period of twelve 12 months from the date of the incident b any parents guest spectator coach or official at any youth sporting event who enters the field of play court mat or rink during any youth sporting event for the purpose of physically or verbally abusing or confronting coaches players or officials shall be banned from attendance at all youth sports events within the township of east greenwich for a period of up to twelve 12 months from the date of the incident c any parent guest spectator coach or official at any youth sports event who verbally abuses officials players or spectators including the use of obscene or profane language or gestures racial ethnic or sexual slurs may be banned from all youth sports events for a period of up to twelve 12 months from the date of the incident and shall be subject to such discipline as provided for by the applicable sports teams code of conduct d any parent guest spectator coach or official at any youth sports event who throws or causes to be deposited any object on the field of play court mat or rink during any youth sports event may be banned from attendance at all youth sports events for a period of up to twelve 12 months from the date of the incident and shall be subject to such discipline as provided for by the applicable sports teams code of conduct e any person banned for twelve 12 months from youth sports events for a violation of this code of conduct prior to being allowed to resume attendance at any youth sports event shall be required to complete an anger management or equivalent counseling program consisting of no less than twelve 12 hours of instruction and shall provide proof of satisfactory completion to the code of conduct committee any banning for less than twelve 12 months may include up to twelve 12 hours of anger management part   authority any parent guest township official coach or spectator at any youth sporting event shall be subject to the authority of all field officials including umpires and referees and elected league officials of the youth sports team or teams sponsoring the youth sports event or in the absence of such persons at a youth sports teams practice or instructional event to the authority of the ranking youth sports team coach on the premises such authority shall include the authorization to direct any person or persons involved in any incident in violation of this chapter or the applicable sports teams code of conduct to immediately remove themselves from the premises failure to comply with residing official will be cause to engage the east greenwich township police part   violation procedures and hearing a any individual may report an incident that they believe constitutes a violation of this chapter to the particular sports governing body if the governing body believes a violation may have taken place they shall report in writing the alleged fact to the code of conduct committee who shall notify the purported violator of the time date and location of a hearing to be held before the code of conduct committee also the committee shall provide a brief description of the alleged violation within the notice the nature shall be by regular mail and certified mail b any person receiving such a notice who wishes to contest same shall appeal to the east greenwich township code of conduct committee within seven calendar days of the mailing of said notice by forwarding a copy of said notice with a written request for appeal specifically setting forth the basis of such persons contest of the notice of violation via personal delivery or certified mail to the chairperson of the code of conduct committee at 159 democrat road mickleton new jersey 08056 c upon receipt of such an appeal the code of conduct committee shall convene within seven days and provide an opportunity for said person and any interested person to appear and be heard with respect to the occurrence of any violation and the action taken by the youth sports team d the code of conduct committee shall be authorized to hear testimony under oath review affidavits and such other and further information or documentation relevant to the alleged violation upon a majority vote of the members of the committee present at such hearing the committee may impose sanctions limiting or precluding the violators participation or attendance at any and all sports team activities within east greenwich township for a period of up to one year the committee may also at anytime decide the matter should be referred to the east greenwich township police department e the township solicitor shall serve as counsel to the code of conduct committee part urination and defecation in public places urination and defecation in public fines  subsequent conviction in addition to any of the fines and imprisonment set forth above and pursuant to new jersey statute njsa 5 a person who is convicted of violating this ordinance within one year of the date of a previous violation of the same ordinance and who was fined for the previous violation shall be sentenced by a court to an additional fine as a repeat offender the additional fine imposed by the court upon a person for a repeated offense shall not exceed the maximum fine fixed for a violation of the ordinance codified in this chapter but shall be calculated separately from the fine imposed for the violation of the ordinance codified in this chapter  part communications amplification systems definitions the following words and terms shall for the purposes of this as used elsewhere in this code have the meanings shown herein apco means association of public safety communications officers international naber means national association of business and education radio gcer means gloucester county emergency response gcems means gloucester county emergency medical services pcia means personal communications industry association fcc means federal communications commission cas means communication amplification system npspac means national public safety planning advisory committee frequencies designed for national radio interoperability    gelneral provisions except as otherwise provided no person shall erect construct alter refit change the use of or provide an addition of more than twenty 20 percent of the existing floor area to any building or structure of any part thereof or cause the same to be done which fails to support adequate radio coverage for gcer gcems and the east greenwich police fire and ambulance departments for the purposes of this chapter adequate radio coverage shall include all of the following 1 a minimum signal strength of one hundred 100 dbm available in ninety 90 percent of the area of each floor of the building when transmitted from the closest gcer radio communications system site  2 a minimum signal strength of one hundred 100 dbm received at the closest gcer radio communications site when transmitted from ninety 90 percent of the area of each floor of the building  3 as the cas is part of the public safety radio system the owner must adapt according to any growth changes or modifications as instructed by local authorities  4 the frequency range which must be supported shall be compatible to the current public safety radio system in use by the township  5 a ninety 90 percent reliability factor  6 signal strength measurements for the purpose of measuring the performance of a bidirectional amplifier shall be based on one input signal adequate to obtain a maximum continuous operating output level the provisions of this chapter shall become applicable upon notification to the property owner that unacceptable performance levels exist the property owner shall have ninety 90 days from date of notification to enhance radio coverage and bring it within the acceptable limits of these provisions    amplification systems allowed buildings and structures which cannot support the required level of radio coverage shall be equipped with either a radiating cable system or an internal multiple antenna system with or without fcc type accepted bidirectional amplifiers as needed if any part of the installed system or systems contains an electrically powered component the system shall be capable of operating on an independent battery andor generator system for a period of at least twelve 12 hours without external power input the battery system shall charge in the presence of an external power input if used bidirectional amplifiers shall include filters to reduce adjacent frequency interference at thirtysix 36 db below the npspac band settings used should not attenuate the npspac frequencies and further provided that they are not more than one 1 mhz from the npspac frequencies    testing procedures when an inbuilding radio system is required and upon completion of installation it will be the building owners responsibility to have the radio system tested to ensure that twoway coverage on each floor of the building is a minimum of ninety 90 percent each floor of the building shall be divided into a grid of approximately twenty 20 equal areas a maximum of two nonadjacent areas will be allowed to fail the test in the event that three of the areas fail the test in order to be more statistically accurate the floor may be divided in forty 40 equal areas in such event a maximum of four nonadjacent areas will be allowed to fail the test after the fortyarea test if the system continues to fail the building owners shall have the system altered to meet the ninety 90 percent coverage requirement the test shall be conducted using the most current motorola portable radio or its equivalent talking gcer as specified by the authority having jurisdiction a spot located approximately in the center of a grid area will be selected for the test then the radio will be keyed to verify twoway communications to and from the outside of the building gcer once the spot has been selected prospecting for a better spot within the grid area will not be permitted the gain values of all amplifiers shall be measured and the test measurement results shall be kept on file with the building owner so that the measurements can be verified each year during the annual tests in the event that the measurement results become lost the building owner will be required to rerun the acceptance test to reestablish the gain values tests shall be made using the following guidelines 1 with a service monitor or signal meter using a unity gain antenna on a small ground plane  2 measurements shall be made with the antenna held in a vertical position at three to four feet above the floor  3 a calibrated service monitor or signal meter with a factory calibration dated within twentyfour 24 months may be used to do the test  4 the gcer representative may also make simultaneous measurements to verify that the equipment is making accurate measurements a variance of three db between the instruments will be allowed  and 5 if measurements in one location are varying then average measurements shall be used tests shall be made using the designated frequencies used by emergency response personnel all tests shall be made in concert with gcer if interference problems are noted it is the owners responsibility to ensure action is taken to reduce them    annual tests when an inbuilding radio system is required the building owner shall test all active components of the system including but not limited to amplifiers power supplies and backup batteries a minimum of once every twelve 12 months amplifiers shall be tested to ensure that the gain is the same as it was upon initial installation and acceptance backup batteries and power supplies shall be tested under load for a period of one hour to verify that they will properly operate during an actual power outage if within the onehour test period in the opinion of the testing technician the battery exhibits symptoms of failure the test shall be extended for additional onehour periods until the testing technician confirms the integrity of the battery all other active components shall be checked to determine that they are operating with the manufacturers specifications for the intended purpose    fiveyear tests in addition to the annual test the building owner shall perform a radio coverage test a minimum of once every five years to insure that the radio system continues to meet the requirements of the original acceptance test the procedure set forth above shall apply to such tests a copy of accepted tests shall be provided to the gcer    qualifications of testing personnel all tests shall be conducted documented and signed by a person in possession of a current fcc technician license or a current technician certification issued by apco naber or the pcia all test records shall be retained on the inspected premises by the building owner and a copy submitted to municipal officials all tests will be performed in conjunction with gcer    field testing police and fire personnel after providing reasonable notice to the owner or his representative shall have the right to enter onto the property to conduct field testing to be certain that the required level of radio coverage is present    exemptions this chapter shall not apply to structures in use groups r3 and r4  any building constructed of wood frame  and building thirtyfive 35 feet high or less  as long as none of the aforementioned buildings make use of any metal construction or any underground storage or parking areas for purposes of this chapter parking structures and stairwells are included in the definition of building and stair shafts are included in the definition of all parts of a building but elevators may be excluded    existing buildings and structures any nonexempt building or structure under construction or for which a building permit application is pending or has been approved as of the effective date of this section  shall comply with the requirements of this chapter if gecer east greenwich fire department andor police department determines that adequate radio coverage as defined does not exist in the building or structure the owner of the building or structure shall be notified in writing of the inadequacy of the coverage and shall have a period of ninety 90 consecutive calendar days from the date of the notice to comply with this section  including but not limited to enhancing radio coverage and bringing it within the acceptable limits of this section  nuisance   unnecessary or unusual noise prohibited a no person shall make continue or cause to be made or continued any loud unnecessary or unusual noise or any noise which does or is likely to annoy disturb injure or endanger the comfort repose health peace or safety of others within the limits of the township  7122011   definition of noise a the following acts are hereby declared to be examples of loud disturbing and unnecessary noise in violation of this section animals birds the keeping of animals or birds which by causing frequent or longcontinued noise disturbs the comfort or repose of any persons in the vicinity blowers the operation of any blower or power fan or any internal combustion engine the operation of which causes noise due to the explosion of operating gases or fluids unless the noise from such blower or fan is muffled and such engine is equipped with a muffler device sufficient to deaden such noise construction or repair the carrying out of excavation demolition construction repair or alteration work other than between the hours of  am and  pm weekdays and saturdays the carrying out of construction repair or alteration work by a homeowner on hisher own dwelling or property other than between the hours of  am and  pm in the case of urgent necessity or in the interest of public health or safety the township engineer may grant a permit for excavation demolition construction repair alteration work for a period not to exceed three days which may be renewed for additional periods of three days while the emergency continues by the terms of which permit such work may be carried on during the hours specified in the permit courts schools churches the creation of excessive noise on a street adjacent to a school institution of learning church or court while in use which the township  minibikes   findings the township committee recognizes the safety hazard created by operation and use on public thoroughfares of minibikes and other motordriven vehicles which do not meet the standard equipment requirements under the motor vehicle laws title 39 of the state of new jersey pursuant to rs 2 the township committee deems it to be in the best interest of the township and necessary and proper for the protection of persons and property therein that all minibikes and similar motordriven vehicles be registered with the township and that their use be controlled 1   definitions as used in this chapter the following terms shall have the meanings indicated minibike means an unlicensed motordriven vehicle or conveyance including but not necessarily limited to two wheel motor vehicles known as minibicycles trail bicycles or motor scooters the term minibike shall not include motorized bicycles as defined in njsa 1 person means any individual association or corporation   prior code  382   registration requirements a registration required from and after  no person shall own ride or operate a minibike within the township unless such minibike is registered pursuant to the terms of this chapter b registration procedure 1 application for registration shall be made by the owner of the minibike to the township clerk upon a form approved by the mayor and the township committee such form shall require the name and address of the owner the make model and serial number of the minibike and such information as the mayor and the township committee shall deem necessary and proper 2 the owner shall sign the registration form and shall certify that the information contained thereon is true 3 a separate registration shall be required for each minibike 4 a registration fee in the amount of two dollars shall accompany each registration form c minibike tags 1 upon receipt of the registration fee and a completed registration form signed by the owner the township clerk shall submit the registration form to the chief of police or his or her designee 2 the chief of police or his or her designee upon receipt of the registration form from the township clerk shall issue to the registrant a minibike tag which shall be attached to the seat of the minibike in a prominent place so as to be visible from the rear the tag number shall be noted on the registration form 3 the chief of police or his or her designee shall be responsible for the custody and maintenance of all registration forms 4 no person shall remove destroy mutilate or alter any minibike tag or the number which appears thereon d transference of ownership every person who sells or transfers ownership of a registered minibike shall report such sale or transfer to the township clerk and shall return the minibike tag issued for such minibike 3   use and operation of minibikes the following regulations shall apply in the use and operation of minibikes a no person shall operate a minibike on the private property of another without the express written permission to do so by the owner of such property b no person shall operate a minibike on any public street located within the township c no person shall operate a minibike on public grounds without express written permission to do so by the chief of police d no person shall operate a minibike in a manner so as to create loud unnecessary or unusual noise so as to disturb or interfere with the peace and quiet of other persons e no person shall operate a minibike in a careless reckless or negligent manner so as to endanger or be likely to endanger the safety of any person or the property of any person 4   impounding of minibikes a display of minibike tag required any minibike which is used or operated and which does not display a minibike tag issued pursuant to this chapter shall be impounded by police and shall be stored in such a place as is designated by the chief of police b reclamation of impounded minibikes the owner of any minibike so impounded may reclaim such upon proof of compliance with the provisions of this chapter and upon payment of all costs and charges incurred by the township for towing and storage of the minibike the chief of police is authorized to prepare a schedule of costs and charges for towing and storage such schedule shall become effective upon publication and filing with the office of the township clerk any modifications to the schedule shall be accomplished in a like manner c police record when a minibike is impounded the police department shall keep and maintain a record which shall contain where possible the color make model year and serial number these records shall also include the date and hour of impoundment the location from which impounded the reason for impoundment the name of the impounding officer and the location at which the minibike is stored 6   violationspenalties a violations by minors any person under the age of eighteen 18 years who shall violate or fail to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter shall be for the first offense reprimanded in writing by the police department such writing shall be addressed to the parents or guardian of the offender and shall state the nature of the violation upon a second or subsequent violation of this chapter a summons shall be issued to appear in municipal court and upon conviction the offender shall be punished by the payment of a fine of not more than two hundred dollars $20000 b violations by adults any person eighteen 18 years of age or older who shall violate or fail to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction be punished by the payment of a fine of not more than two hundred dollars $20000 or imprisonment for ten 10 days or both 5 offroad vehicles   findings a the township committee deems it necessary and proper for the good government order and protection of persons and property and for the preservation of the public health safety and welfare of the township and its inhabitants to enact an ordinance regulating the operation of snowmobiles motorcycles motorized bikes and other two three andor four wheel motor powered offroad type vehicles on private property with the township b such regulation is considered necessary and proper to regulate the operation of snowmobiles motorcycles motorized bikes and other two three andor four wheel motor powered offroad type vehicles on private property when such vehicles are being used for recreational purposes or other nonfarm purposes 1   use over private property restricted the operation of any snowmobile motorcycle or motorized bike as defined by the applicable provisions of title 39 of the new jersey statutes and the operation of any other two three andor four wheel motor powered offroad type vehicle hereinafter referred to as subject vehicles by any person whether or not that person is the owner of such subject vehicle over andor across the private property of another is expressly prohibited unless the operator thereof has in his or her possession and on his or her person written consent or permission of the owner or user of the private property to be affected for the operation of the subject vehicle over andor across such private property 2   display of written consent failure to produce written consent or permission upon demand by any police officer of the township shall be presumptive evidence in any court of competent jurisdiction of operating the subject vehicle without the written consent or permission of the owner or user of the private property affected as required by this chapter 3   enforcement any police officer of the township shall enforce this chapter on the basis of personal observation or investigation or on the basis of a signed complaint under oath of any owner or user of private property affected by a violation of this chapter and such police officer shall issue the appropriate summones to effectuate such enforcement and may impound the subject vehicle as more fully provided by 4   impounding of vehicle any subject vehicle which is used or operated in violation of this chapter shall be subject to impoundment by any police officer of the township and shall be stored in such a place as is designated by the chief of police until such time as the owner of the subject vehicle so impounded makes payment to the township for all costs and charges incurred by the township in the towing and storage of the impounded subject vehicle and until such further time as adequate restitution has been made to the aggrieved owner or user of the private property so affected for damages to property caused by the operation of the subject vehicle in violation of this chapter 5   exception it is not intended that the prohibitions contained in this chapter be applicable to any subject vehicles being operated for legitimate farming purposes 6   violationpenalty any person who shall violate or fail to comply with this chapter upon conviction in the municipal court shall be punished by the payment of a fine of not less than fifty dollars $5000 nor more than two hundred dollars $20000 or imprisonment in jail for a term not to exceed thirty 30 days or both 7 rotary towing of vehicles   rotary list the township committee shall establish rates for towing certain vehicles within the township as well as certain qualifying rules and regulations for the awarding of towing contracts in accordance with njsa 249 as well as storage fees in accordance with njsa 50 the contract shall be awarded after notice of advertisement for tow contract to be published by the township the services provided by the tow contractor shall be evenly divided between the contractors with each contractor providing his or her services for a twoweek interval beginning on sunday at  and concluding fourteen 14 days later on saturday at  pm the contractor shall rotate and there shall be only two contractors for the township it shall be the responsibility of the chief of police to be certain that the dispatching personnel are familiar with the chapter and provide a schedule of contractors to contact the tow contractors list will be valid from january 1 to december 31 of each calendar year and no tow companies are permitted to be added to the schedule during that time unless a vacancy exists the rotary list is from january 1 to december 31 no tow companies are permitted to be added to the schedule during that time unless a vacancy is created part 2002    application and approval process the term of a towing contract shall be one year also applicants must apply on or before december 15 for the following calendar year the township must advertise for tow contracts along with all professional services which are granted at the reorganization meeting part 2002    denial suspension revocation hearings when an application is denied by the township of east greenwich the applicant may request a hearing on said application by the service of a notice requesting a hearing said notice shall be served on the township clerk and at the next regular scheduled meeting of the governing body a hearing date shall be set which shall be no less than seven days nor more than thirty 30 days from the date scheduled part 2002   regulations a the police department in general and the chief of police in particular shall enforce the within provisions b the chief of police is hereby authorized and empowered to establish from time to time written policies and procedures as may be reasonable and necessary to obtain compliance with the terms of this chapter and the laws of the state of new jersey c all regulations policies and procedures shall be made available for inspection by the public at the township clerks office during normal business hours d complaints by motor vehicle owners of any tow contractor shall be referred to the chief of police who shall promptly investigate and resolve any dispute part 2002   general requirements a the rates applicable to towing services performed hereunder code shall be posted in a conspicuous place visible to the public at the contractors place of business b the contractor shall at its expense prepare a printed bill for distribution to the customer reflecting the fee to be paid in accordance with the rates stated herein the bill shall also include a statement to the effect that all complaints shall be referred to the police department c hours of service 1 towing services must be provided on a twentyfour 24 hour sevenday per week basis all wreckers must be equipment with twoway communications to facilitate prompt response it is required that a tow vehicle be on the site of the event within fifteen 15 minutes of the time of the call from the police department the contractor shall provide the police department with a telephone number which will be operational at all times to quickly dispatch tow vehicles 2 the contractors normal hours of operation for the public shall be from  am to  pm monday 00 noon to  pm on sunday d employees 1 contractor shall employ a sufficient number of employees to comply with the minimum operational requirements 2 contractor shall have conducted the required background check of the employee and confirm that all statutory and regulatory requirement and other requisite criteria have been met 3 all drivers of the contractors shall be over the age of eighteen 18 years and must have a valid current new jersey state drivers license cdl commercial drivers license and shall be in good health and of good moral character e in order to keep information current the contractor shall supply an updated list of drivers to the police department f all employees of the contractor shall wear uniform clothing with a name patch indicating the employees first name and the name of the contractors company all employees shall be clean neat and make a good appearance all employees of contractor shall be required to wear photo identification badges g the contractor agrees that the owners or officers of the contractors shall be responsible except as otherwise provided by law for the reckless negligent andor careless acts of their employees or agents while acting hereunder h the contractor shall record all vehicles towed in a book kept for such purposes the details of each disabled vehicle towed serviced or transported together with full information of the towed vehicle and name and address of the owner and the charges paid for his services full information of the towed vehicle shall include but not be limited to the vehicles license number vin registration number make model color and year the record book herein described shall be kept open for inspection and at all times by any duly authorized representative of the township a monthly towing record containing the information herein stated above shall be filed with the township of east greenwich police department and office of the township clerk setting forth the details of all tows by vehicle type date time of day sector and whether additional services were required each incident shall be reported using the invoice number used for billing the form of these reports shall be approved by the chief of police i the contractors shall maintain a record of all personal property in a towed vehicle that are observed in sight at the time the vehicle comes into possession j authorized representatives of the township shall have access to any of the records required to be kept by the contractor k towing contractors shall have a designated inside storage facility for purposes of police investigations l it shall be the responsibility to the contractor to label all vehicles that are towed for the police department by labeling either the windshield or some visible part of the vehicle that will identify a police investigation this information will be supplied by the investigating officer no vehicles will be released unless there is written authorization from the police department to the contractor for release part 2002    equipment a the contractor must provide with its application a detailed listing of the equipment to be utilized while on the towing list the listing shall include the following information type of vehicle storage locations of vehicles and whether vehicle is owned or leased each piece of the equipment must meet the minimum standards set forth herein equipment that cannot meet these minimum standards shall not be used for the rotary list the contractor is solely responsible for the safety maintenance and operation of each piece of equipment utilized while on the rotary list the contractor shall provide a minimum of equipment to handle multi vehicle collisions involving passenger vehicles heavy equipment andor trucks b the towing contractor shall supply manufacturers certification of the lifting capacities of the devices of type of vehicle with application submission a certified testing laboratory test result is also acceptable for rating lift capacity c tow vehicles shall be equipped with twoway radios for communications with contractors office facilities these communications shall be available twentyfour 24 hours a day d tow vehicles shall be equipped at all times with safety vests for operations firstaid kits hand tools lockout kits flashlight broom shovel work gloves and receipts for services rendered e tow vehicles shall be kept in a clean and neat appearance so as to be reasonably accommodating to a person who may come in contact with such vehicle and if stored storage shall be in a six foot high chain linked area with locking gates and monitored cameras f tow vehicles shall have the name address and telephone number of the contractor painted on or permanently attached to both sides of the tow vehicle in compliance with motor vehicle and traffic laws of new jersey title 39 of the revised statutes g all tow vehicles shall be properly permitted by the state of new jersey for the use of flashing amber emergency lights permits shall be in compliance with motor vehicle and traffic laws as referenced above h all tow vehicles shall be registered in the name of the contractor in compliance with motor vehicle and traffic laws as referenced above applicant must have the capabilities to tow commercial vehicles with the maximum gross vehicle weight of eighty thousand 80000 pounds applicant must have the capabilities to tow a minimum of three vehicles at the same time part 2002    towing and storage fee speed limit of 25 mph as defined in title 98b1  traffic control work zones   adoption the township committee hereby finds and declares that problems of traffic control occur when traffic must be moved around street construction maintenance operations and utility work both above and below ground which requires the blocking of roadways and obstructing the safe flow of traffic and that such obstructions are or can become dangerous when not properly controlled in order to better promote the public health safety peace and welfare it is necessary to establish controls and regulations directed to the safe and expeditious movement of traffic maintenance zones and to provide safety for the work force performing these operations the township of east greenwich in the county of gloucester and state of new jersey does hereby adopt the current manual on uniform traffic control devices hereby known as mutcd except as hereby supplemented and amended as it controls and regulates whenever construction maintenance operations or utility work obstructs the normal flow of traffic a person contractor or utility failing to comply with the provisions of mutcd while performing such work is in violation of this section part   preconstruction meeting it shall be the responsibility of the person contractor or in the case of a public utility as required under the public utility agreement wishing to conduct work within under or above the roadway to contact the office of the chief of police for east greenwich township in order to arrange a preconstruction meeting to submit plans for the safe movement of traffic during such period of construction work any person contractor or utility failing to comply with this section prior to the start of such work or whose plan is not approved by the chief of police is in violation of this section part   hazardous conditions the person contractor or utility shall provide the police department with at least two emergency contact phone numbers to be called in case of any problems occurring at the construction site or maintenance site during offhours or prior to the start of any work if for any reason emergency contact cannot be made or emergency contact personnel fail to respond to the call from the police department to correct the hazardous condition the township may respond to correct such hazardous condition reasonable fees for such service by the township shall be charged to the person contractor or utility responsible for such conditions part   hours of operation there shall be no construction maintenance operations or utility work on any roadway in the township of east greenwich prior to the hour of  am or after  pm this time limit may be adjusted by the chief of police to permit work prior to or after the stated times if reasonable conditions apply and only after thorough review of a request to modify working hours part   road closings and detours road closings andor traffic detours shall not be permitted unless approved by the east greenwich township police department part   traffic directors traffic directors shall be posted at all construction or maintenance sites when determined by the east greenwich township police department that same is necessary to provide for the safe and expeditious movement of traffic part   stop work the east greenwich township police department shall have the authority to stop work including the removal of equipment and vehicles stored material within the street rightofway back filling of open excavations andor other related work in order to abate any nuisance andor safety hazard or for any violation of this section part   site preparation no materials vehicles or equipment are to be placed in the roadway or sidewalk area until all construction signs lights devices and pavement markings are installed part   violations and penalties any person contractor or utility who commits a violation of this chapter shall upon conviction thereof pay a fine of not less than one hundred dollars $10000 nor more than one thousand dollars $100000 andor may be imprisoned in the county jail for a term not exceeding ninety 90 days or both a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day or on which each violation occurs or continues to occur part crosswalks   midblock crosswalks the following locations are established as midblock areas  title 12  streets sidewalks and public places streets and roads generally   township road defined the term township road shall mean the full width of the road meaning and intending the traveled portion the shoulder the slopes up to and including the rightofway line 1   regulations it is unlawful for any person without first obtaining a written permit from the township committee to a tear up cause to be thrown or placed upon any township road trash stones dirt or other materials other than for the purpose of constructing repairing and maintaining township roads  e discharge or drain or permit or cause to be discharged or drained upon any township road any liquid or material such as sewage wash water drainage from any pig pen barn yard gas station or other place where the fluid or activity to which the order shall be effective within ten 10 days of receipt of the notice unless otherwise stated within the notice 2   street opening regulations a no person shall cause any part or portion of a street road or rightofway under control of the township committee to be opened excavated or altered for the purpose of installing repairing or maintaining any utility without first having obtained a permit from the township b the application shall first be submitted to the township engineer for review and recommendation as to street rehabilitation and sufficiency of bond no permit shall be granted until all of the pertinent facts have been presented to the township committee at an authorized meeting at which time the township shall approve the issuance of a permit before it may be issued upon approval applicant shall pay a fee of three hundred dollars $30000 c in order to obtain a permit the applicant shall submit a sketch of the area to be opened excavated or altered setting forth the exact dimensions to be disturbed in addition thereto a bond shall be posted in any amount recommended by the engineer sufficient to guarantee the restoration of the street to a condition as close as is practicable to the condition of the street before it was disturbed d the applicant shall submit to the township engineer a list of the materials to be used to restore the street to its condition e the bond to be posted shall not be released until the engineer has certified to the township committee that the street has been restored to an acceptable condition f in lieu of a bond the applicant may submit cash or a certified check g in the event of an emergency the applicant may obtain the approval of the township engineer or the township committeeperson responsible for roads  however all other aspects of this section shall be satisfied as quickly as is practicable     4   violationpenalty any person shall be deemed to violate the terms of this chapter if he or she does any of the acts prohibited herein or causes the acts by means of an agent and upon conviction shall be subject to a fine not exceeding fifty dollars $5000 or imprisonment for a period not exceeding fifteen 15 days or both 3 park and recreation area use regulations   intent the township has attempted to provide certain areas within the township that are set out for recreational use it is the intention of the township to provide these facilities and maintain the order and dignity for the usage of same that is in keeping with the inhabitants of the township by establishing certain rules and regulations it is believed that the parks and recreational areas will afford the inhabitants a safe sanitary and wholesome location for recreational purposes 1   hours of usage all areas designated within the township as parks or recreational areas shall be open from the hours of nine am until five pm except during daylight savings time when the closing hours shall be eightthirty pm however when there are organized games or events illuminated by the park lights the park closing time shall be one hour after the conclusion of the event or game 2   reserved   prohibitions hunting trapping camping swimming littering use of trail or minibikes burning an open fire unless authorized by the township committee the use of alcoholic beverages the possession of alcoholic beverages hereinafter smoking or the use of tobacco related products andor discard of those products in an area designated as tobacco free or within fifty 50 feet of any park andor recreation area owned leased or utilized by the township of east greenwich andor the youth sports organizations of the township of east greenwich part  prior code  394   open fires there shall be no open fires unless an application has been made to the township committee and permission granted by that body the application shall set forth the purpose of the open fire as well as the exact date and time to which permission is sought for the open fire authorization shall not be for more than one day 5   tennis courtsprohibition of other activities a prohibition of other activities the tennis courts located at composition  appointment  compensation there is hereby created a shade tree commission consisting of not less than three and not more than five members who shall be residents of the township which commission shall be known as the shade tree commission of the township of east greenwich and shall be appointed by the mayor and shall serve without compensation except as hereinafter provided    jurisdiction of the commission the shade tree commission of the township of east greenwich shall have jurisdiction over the planting care control and removal of shade and ornamental trees and shrubbery upon and in the streets highways public places parks and parkways of the township  except state highways unless the state highway department shall assent thereto  and except county highways parks and parkways of gloucester now or hereinafter has a county shade tree commission unless the county shade tree commission shall assent thereto    terms the commission shall be appointed within sixty 60 days from the final passage of this chapter  and their terms shall commence upon the day of their appointments and be for the respective periods of three four and five years counted from january 1 next succeeding their appointment all subsequent appointments except to fill vacancies shall be for the full term of three years to take effect on january 1 nest succeeding such appointments in event that the membership of any commission is increased the new members shall be appointed in such manner that the terms shall expire in accordance with the foregoing    organization the commission shall organize within thirty 30 days after the appointment of its total membership for the remainder of the thencalendar year and thereafter annually by the election of one of its members as chairman and the appointment of a secretary    powers the shade tree commission of the township shall have power to a exercise full and exclusive control over the regulation planting care andor removal of shade and ornamental trees and shrubbery now located or which may hereinafter be planted in any public highway park or parkway b regulate and control the use of the ground surrounding same so far as may be necessary for their proper growth care and protection c move or require the removal of any tree or part thereof dangerous to public safety d care for and control such parks and parkways  encourage arboriculture  and make alter amend and repeal in the manner prescribed for the passage alteration amendment and repeal of ordinances by the governing body of the municipality any and all ordinances necessary or proper for carrying out the provisions hereof e administer treatment to or remove any tree situated upon private property which is believed to harbor a disease or insects readily communicable to neighboring healthy trees in the care of the municipality and enter upon private property for that purpose with the consent of the owner thereof provided that the suspected condition is first confirmed by certificate issued by or on behalf of the department of agriculture    cost of trees and improvements a except as hereinafter provided the initial cost of all trees planted by the commission the cost of planting the same the cost of the posts and boxes or guards used for the protection thereof and the cost of the removal of any tree or part thereof dangerous to public safety shall if the commission shall so determine in accordance with uniform rules and regulations promulgated for this purpose be a charge upon the real estate in front of which such tree or trees shall be planted or removed as an improvement thereof such cost if it is so determined that it is to be paid by the owner shall unless paid directly to the commission be certified by it to the collector of taxes of the municipality shall thereupon become and be a lien upon said real estate shall be included in the next tax bill rendered to the owner or owners thereof and be collected in the same manner as other taxes against that property b the provisions of this section shall not apply to 1 a planting to replace a tree or trees theretofore planted by the commission 2 a planting in connection with arbor day exercises or other educational demonstration    public improvements affecting trees  consent of commission  county park commissions unaffected no statute giving any person or state county or municipal board body or official power or authority to lay any sidewalk along or to open construct curb or pave any street or to do any similar act shall be construed to permit or authorize any interference with or injury to a highway shade tree without the consent of the shade tree commission within whose jurisdiction such tree shall be located in all cases such commission shall reasonably cooperate with such person board body or official for the general public good nothing contained in this chapter shall be held to take away or diminish any of the powers or authority of the county park commission over the trees or shrubbery in any county park or parkway within its jurisdiction or to give any other commission or board any power or authority with respect to such trees or shrubbery    annual appropriation a during the month of december in each year the shade tree commission of the township of east greenwich shall certify to the governing body of the municipality the estimated sum necessary for the proper conduct of its work during the ensuing fiscal year which shall include the sums estimated to be expended for such of the following items as it is anticipated expenditure will be made 1 payment of wages and salaries of employees 2 expenses of commission members in discharging official duties including expenses incident to attendance at professional meetings 3 purchase of trees and shrubbery 4 purchase of necessary equipment and material and the cost of services for the prudent promotion of the work b the township committee of the township of east greenwich shall annually appropriate such sums as it may deem necessary for said purposes    regulations of commission no person shall do any of the following acts to shade any administering governmental affairs e remove or damage any guard or device placed to protect any tree or shrub f conduct razing removal or renovation of any structure if deemed by the commission to be damaging to neighboring street trees g place or distribute chemicals including but not limited to salt deleterious to tree health h maintain a stationary fire or device which vaporizes noxious fumes deleterious to tree health i remove soil either for trenching or otherwise j construct new sidewalks andor driveways with any material whatsoever within five feet of a tree k plant any tree or shrub within the designated area under the control of the commission    penalty for violation of commission ordinances  jurisdiction of courts a the commission may prescribe a fine for the violation of its commission of the township of east greenwich or as a charge against real estate as provided by law shall be forthwith paid over to the township treasurer  title 13  public services water service system   definitions as used in this chapter applicant means a petitioner to the township committee requesting potable water service customer means the applicant or use of water service at one household or business whether tenant or owner lateral means the service line piping and appurtenances extending from the distribution main to the users premises main means the township owned or leased piping and appurtenances in or along public streets or highways or in or along township rightsofway or easements used for the transmission or distribution of water    laterals a installation and maintenance the installation of the lateral from the main to and including the curb shutoff shall be the responsibility of the customer the township shall be responsible for maintenance of the lateral from the main to the street side of the curb shutoff the installation and maintenance of the lateral from connection at the curb shutoff to the premises served shall be the responsibility of the customer the lateral installation shall be completed by a licensed plumber and shall include all road opening permits excavation and restoration for a complete installation the construction materials and installation shall be inspected and approved by the township water superintendent who shall be notified at least twentyfour 24 hours in advance of construction all construction work shall be done during normal township business hours for the extension of new water mains the installation of the lateral from the main to and including the curb shutoff shall be the responsibility of the party constructing such extension whether it be the applicant or the township b construction materials laterals shall be copper ktype or ductile iron cementmortar linedclass 52 installed to provide suitable connection to meters in the event that the house to be connected is situated more than two hundred 200 feet back from the property line where the water supply originates then a state building plastic pipe may be used in lieu of copper all pipes shall be installed to provide suitable connection to meters water service pipe at point of entrance to the building shall be made of copper tube or copper pipe copper tube when used underground shall not be less the k in those cases where a qualified owner elects to use and install plastic pipes as per the preceding paragraphs the township shall place the meter at the property line where the supply originates c renewal of laterals if the renewal of a lateral from the main to the curb stop or meter pit is found to be necessary by the township committee the lateral shall be renewed in the same location as previously used if the customer desires the lateral at some other location and agrees to pay any additional expense of such relocation in excess of installing the lateral in the same location as previously used and cutting off and disconnecting the old lateral the township committee shall install the new lateral at the location desired d service lateral tap charge although there is no tap charge for the extension of existing water mains there shall be a service lateral tap charge the amount of which shall be in accordance with the rate schedule hereinafter set forth    meters a property of the township all meters are and shall become and remain the property of the township and shall at all times be under the control of and subject to inspection of the township committee b installation and maintenance the township shall be responsible for supplying and installing all water meters up to oneinch the material costs for the water meter and readout shall be set by the township and shall be the responsibility of the customer additionally the meter installation fee shall be one hundred dollars $10000 which shall be paid prior to installation all meters one and onehalfinch and longer shall be the customers responsibility to purchase and install the neptune t10 meter the township shall provide maintenance of the water meter however replacements repairs or adjustments of any nature rendered necessary by the act neglect or carelessness of the owner or occupant of any premises or any expense to the township caused thereby shall be charges against and collected from the owner of the premises the owner of any premise where a meter curb box and rods are installed shall be responsible for its care and protection from freezing and from hot water and from injuries or interferences by any person in case of any injury to the meter or in case of its stoppage or imperfect working the owner shall give immediate notice to the township committee the owner of a property where a curb box is installed after  shall be responsible for having the top of a curb box at ground level visible at all times for accessibility and service c location of meters meters shall be located and fixed in such place or places as the township committee may determine no person other than the authorized agent or employee of the township committee shall change the location or alter or interfere in any way with any meter any unauthorized person or persons other than as described herein changing the location altering interfering or tampering with the meter or the seal affixed thereto shall be subject to a fine of five hundred dollars $50000 d testingdetermination of accuracy periodic tests of meters shall be carried under regulations prescribed by the township committee its authorized agent or employee if the meter is found to register more than three percent less water than actually passes a new meter may be substituted and the township committee shall adjust the water bill in such a manner as if fair and just the accuracy of the meter on any premises shall be tested by the township committee upon written request of the owner who shall pay in advance a fee of onehundred dollars $10000 for up to oneinch meters and twohundred dollars $20000 for up to twoinch meters to cover the cost of the test if on such test the meter is found to register over three percent more water to the owner than actually passes another meter shall be substituted therefore and the fee shall be repaid to the owner in such a manner as is fair and just         water use regulations a restrictions no restrictions upon the quantity of water used on any premises from the mains shall be enforced except as follows 1 no person shall take or use water from the mains from premises other than his or her own and no person shall sell or give away any water from the mains from his or her own premises for any purpose 2 in time of serious emergency the committee may limit the use of water 3 preventable waste shall not be allowed  water will be shut off in case of leaks remaining unrepaired b the township committee has the authority to declare a serious emergency and if so declared the township committee may limit the use of water a declaration of serious emergency must be done by resolution of the township committee and the specific limitations of use of water must be set forth with that resolution if township committee adopts a resolution declaring a serious emergency as set forth in this section the provisions of that resolution shall supersede the provisions of b until the emergency is over as declared by the township committee c hydrants only persons authorized by the committee shall take water from any public fire hydrant or water main appurtenance except for fire purposes or for the use of the fire department in case of fire no water main appurtenances shall be used for any purpose other than fire purposes without first securing the written approval and consent of the committee d automatic fire protective devices and hydrants for automatic sprinklers or other automatic fire service protective devices located inside a building or buildings a separate service line will be required to be used exclusively for fire service at the option of the customer fire hydrants located outside of the buildings may be connected to the fire service line each such separate service line shall be subject to the charges shown in the rate schedule the township reserves the right to refuse approval for an application for automatic fire service where in the judgment of the township such service is not practical all meters for private fire service shall be approved by the township but shall be furnished and installed by the customer meters will be set in an approved type of brick or concrete masonry meter vaults adequately drained located on the premises of the customer the meter vaults are to be constructed and maintained at the expense of the customer meters and vaults shall at all times be accessible to the township its officers and employees e private unmetered fire service when in the judgment of the township it is practical private unmetered fire service lines may be permitted to be installed at the expense of the owner and shall be subject to the charges shown in the rate schedule         connections a connections required the owners of all buildings now erected and the owner of every building hereafter erected or acquired which is located within two hundred 200 feet of any public water supply main and is located upon a street rightofway or easement in which a public water supply main is constructed shall be required to connect with that public water supply main within one hundred eighty 180 days of the installation of the public water supply main b failure to make connectionstownship installations upon installations of a water main the township committee shall give written notice of installation to every building owner affected by such installation if the owners of those buildings affected fail to install the required water tiein connection within one hundred eighty 180 days after such written notice is given the township committee may cause such water tiein connection to be made under the direction and supervision of the township engineer before proceeding to make any such connection or installation the township committee shall cause notice of such contemplated connection or installation to be given to the owner of any properties affected thereby such notice shall contain a description of the property affected sufficiently definite in terms of identifying it as well as a description of the required connections and notice that unless the connection or installation is completed within thirty 30 days after the service thereof the township shall proceed to make such connection or cause same to be done all written notices shall be served upon the owners or owners residents in the township or shall be mailed to any nonresidents last known post office address  notice may also be served upon the occupant of the property or upon the agent of the owner in charge thereof if the owner of such property is unknown or service cannot be made as above directed notice shall be published at least once not less than thirty 30 days before the making of such connection by the township in a newspaper circulated within the township c assessment of costs if the property owner fails to make such connections and the township committee is required to install the water tiein connection the cost of such installation shall become a lien upon the property if the cost remains unpaid by the property owner for thirty 30 days after assessment every such connection or installation charge shall bear interest and penalties from the same time and at the same rate as assessments for local improvements in the township where the same title to new mains be vested in the township by instruments approved by the township solicitor d general requirementsmain extensions utilizing public roads or rightsofway residential subdivisions containing three or fewer building sites or commercial or industrial buildings deemed by the township committee to be too removed from existing water mains or in the event the volume of potable water required is greater than capabilities of the townships existing facilities shall be permitted to provide their own potable water systems provided plans for the onsite potable water system meet the minimum standards promulgated by all appropriate government agencies residential subdivisions containing four or more building sites or commercial or industrial buildings when deemed practical by the committee shall be required to extend mains and provide connections to the townships water system during the construction but before final acceptance the committee shall have the right of use of any completed portion of the system without waiving its right to further inspection and testing or to order correction of any defects e general requirementsmain extensionsprivate property prior to the construction and dedicate the entire water distribution system upon approval by the township engineer to the township any and all agreements necessary to accomplish the provisions of this subsection shall first meet the approval of the township solicitor f industrial service industrial and commercial establishments making application for water service in addition to making written application for such services shall furnish a detailed description of the type and size of buildings nature of the business to be conducted in each structure and the number and type of fixtures to be served such may be required by the township solicitor or other reasonable administrative costs the township engineer shall provide an estimate of escrow fees required which shall be posted by the applicant prior to the incurring of any administrative costs the township engineer shall provide an estimate of escrow fees required which shall be posted by the applicant prior to the incurring of any administrative costs upon completion of the main extension an accounting shall be made to the applicant of funds expended and balances due the applicant shall be returned should a determination by the township
