may be discontinued at the sole discretion of the township for any of the following reasons 1 misrepresentation in application  2 willful waste of water or imperfect pipes fixtures or otherwise  3 destruction or damage to any service pipe or any other appliance of the township  4 nonpayment of any charge accruing under the application  5 refusal of reasonable access to the property for purposes of inspecting reading repairing or removing meters andor plumbing  6 making or refusing to sever any cross connection between a pipe or fixture furnished by the township and a pipe or fixture from any other source  7 nonpayment of bills within the time prescribed  8 violation of any rules of the township e renewal service service will be renewed when the conditions under which such service was disconnected are corrected and upon payment of all accrued charges provided in the schedule of rates or rules of the township f deposits 1 deposits may be required from any customer who becomes habitually delinquent the amount of the deposit shall be equal to his or her average quarterly bill 2 any customer having paid a deposit shall pay bills for water service as rendered in accordance with the rates rules and regulations of the township the deposit shall not be considered as payment on account of a bill during the time the customer is receiving service 3 deposits shall be returned to the depositor when he or she shall have paid undisputed bills for service for a period of twelve 12 consecutive months 4 no interest will be paid on deposits g continuing obligation to pay service charge upon connection of an improved and usable property to water the obligation to pay the minimal annual service charge continues despite the failure to occupy the property or to use the water facilities so long as the building or structure on the property is still available for use and the water facilities remain available      violationpenalty any person violating any provision of of this chapter shall be subject to penalties as set forth in if a person is determined to be in such violation each and every day of such violation shall constitute a separate offense    water emergency a declaration of water emergency whenever the township committee shall be satisfied and finds that a water emergency exists in the township it may adopt a resolution declaring that a water emergency exists in the township such resolution shall be adopted by the township committee at a regular special adjourned or emergency public meeting of the committee such resolution shall identify that portion of the township affected by the water emergency which may include the entire township and shall specify which of the water use regulations contained in subsection b of this section is being imposed as well as any exemptions as may be authorized such resolution shall be effective immediately upon publication according to law and shall continue in effect for ninety 90 days unless extended or repealed as set forth in subsection c of this section for the purposes of this subsection a water emergency shall exist if for any of the following reasons 1 the public utility providing water service to all or a portion of the township has adopted water use restrictions has notified the township the new jersey board of public utilities the new jersey department of environmental protection as well as any other state county or local agency entitled to notice of such restrictions and such restrictions are not overruled or declared invalid by any state county or local agency having the jurisdiction and the power to do so  or 2 the township committee is otherwise satisfied that a water emergency exists in the township b water use restrictions upon adoption by the township committee of a resolution declaring that a water emergency exists in the township in accordance with subsection a of this section all citizens shall be urged to observe voluntary indoor conservation measures and any of the following water use restrictions shall be imposed and shall be applicable to all residents and tenants except where a bona fide health emergency exists and to exempt businesses as specified herein during the water emergency 1 the complete ban and prohibition of outside water usage including the watering of lawns and plants the filling of pools and the washing of cars  2 outside water usage on alternate days allowing outside water usage by persons or businesses having even house or box numbers on even days and those having odd house or box numbers on odd days with outside water usage being completely banned and prohibited on the thirtyfirst 31st day of any month during the water emergency  or 3 any other water use restriction specified by the township committee in the resolution required by subsection a of this section which is reasonable under the circumstances considering the nature and extent of the water emergency any water restriction imposed pursuant to this subsection shall be limited in application to that portion of the township which may include the entire township identified as being affected by the water emergency in the resolution adopted c duration of water use restrictions the resolution adopted in addition to complying with subsection a of this section shall provide a period of time during which the water use restrictions imposed shall be applicable and which shall be no longer than reasonably necessary to abate the water emergency under the circumstances considering the nature and extent of the water emergency at the expiration of the time period specified in the resolution the water use restriction shall lapse and be inapplicable and unenforceable if the township committee shall be satisfied that the water emergency has been abated prior to the expiration of the time period specified in the resolution it shall adopt a resolution declaring the water emergency ended and the water use restrictions inapplicable if at the expiration of the time period specified in the resolution the township committee shall be satisfied that the water emergency continues to exist it may adopt a resolution in accordance with the requirements of this section continuing the water use restrictions d enforcement of water use restrictionspenalty for first offense the water use restrictions imposed pursuant to this section shall be enforced during a water emergency by the local authorized official the local authorized official is hereby empowered to write summonses for the violation of the water use restrictions imposed pursuant to this section e penalties for second third and subsequent offenses after a first offense in accordance with subsection d of this section any person or business who thereafter violates the water use restrictions imposed pursuant to this section shall be fined or imprisoned in accordance with this subsection for a second offense the fine imposed shall be five hundred dollars $50000 or imprisonment for ten 10 days or both for a third and subsequent offense the fine imposed shall be one thousand dollars $100000 or imprisonment for thirty 30 days or both   prior code  109    sewer service system   purpose the purpose of the east greenwich sewer department is to foster and promote relief of waters from pollution and abate the menace to public health these rates rules and regulations are established for the conduct of the townships business to cover the use of the sanitary sewer system to provide a schedule of fees and rates to outline allowable procedures and whatever else is deemed proper and relevant to operating the township sanitary sewer system a21   office of township and hours of business the principal office of the township place of business and mailing address is the township of east greenwich 21 east cohawkin road clarksboro new jersey 08020 the office of the township will be open for the purpose of the transaction of regular business during regular business hours each weekday monday except holidays a22   definitions unless the context specifically indicates otherwise the meaning of the terms used in these rules and regulations shall be as follows biochemical oxygen demand bod means the quantity of oxygen utilized in the biochemical oxidation of organic matter under standard laboratory procedure in five days and twenty 20 degrees centigrade expressed in milligrams per liter building drain means that part of the lowest horizontal piping of a drainage system which receives the discharge from waste and other wastewater drainage pipes inside the walls of the building and conveys it to the building sewer building sewer means the extension from the building to the public sewer or other place of disposal also called house connection or lateral domestic consumer unit means a dwelling or structure normally occupied by a singlefamily and equivalent to a specific flow rate as defined by the nj department of environmental protection domestic sewage means the normal waterborne fluid wastes from residences commercial establishments institutions and industrial establishments limited to the wastes from kitchens bathrooms water closets lavatories and laundries easement means an acquired legal right for the specific use of land owned by others floatable oil means oil fat or grease in a physical state such that it will separate by gravity from wastewater by treatment in an approved pretreatment facility the wastewater shall be considered free of floatable fat if it is properly pretreated and the wastewater does not interfere with the collection system garbage means the animal and vegetable waste resulting from the handling preparation cooking and serving of foods garbage properly shredded properly shredded garbage means the wastes from the preparation cooking and dispensing of food that have been shredded to such a degree that all particles will be carried freely under the flow conditions normally prevailing in public sewers with no particle greater than onehalf inch 127 centimeters in any dimension industrial wastes means the wastewater from industrial processes trade or business as distinct from domestic or sanitary wastes or sewage ph means the logarithm of the reciprocal of the hydrogen ion concentration the concentration is the weight of hydrogen ions in grams per liter of solution neutral water for example has a ph value of 7 public sewer means a common sewer controlled by a governmental agency or public utility sanitary disposal system individual individual sanitary disposal system means an onsite sewage system by which a residential structure manages the treatment and disposal of its waste commercial and industrial structures are specifically exempted sanitary sewer means a sewer that carries liquid and water carried wastes from residences commercial buildings industrial plants and institutions together with minor quantities of ground storm and surface water that are not admitted intentionally sewage means the spent water of a community the preferred term is wastewater sewer means a pipe or conduit that carries wastewater or drainage water sewer department means the east greenwich township sewer department slug means any discharge of water or wastewater which in concentration of any given constituent or in quantity of flow exceeds for any period of duration longer than fifteen 15 minutes more than five times the average twentyfour 24 hour concentration of flows during normal operation and shall adversely affect the collection system andor performance of the wastewater treatment works storm drain or storm sewer means a drain or sewer for conveying water groundwater subsurface water or unpolluted water from any source superintendent means the superintendent or person in charge of wastewater facilities andor of water pollution control of the township surface grading means the process by which virgin ground is altered to adjust ground elevation suspended solids means total suspended matter that either floats on the surface of or is in suspension in water wastewater or other liquids and that is removable by laboratory filtering as prescribed in standard methods of the examination of water and wastewater 13th edition of the american public health association washington dc 197 and referred to as nonfilterable residue virgin ground means ground in its natural state wastewater means the spent water of a community from the standpoint of source it may be a combination of the liquid and watercarried wastes from residences commercial buildings industrial plants and institutions together with any groundwater surface water and stormwater that may be present wastewater facilities means the structures equipment and processes required to collect pump and pretreat domestic and industrial wastes and dispose of the effluent wastewater treatment works means an arrangement of devices and structures for treating wastewater industrial wastes and sludge sometimes used as synonymous with waste treatment plant or wastewater treatment plant or water pollution control plant water unpolluted unpolluted water means water of quality equal to or better than the effluent criteria in effect for the receiving water or water that would not cause violation of receiving water quality standards a3   sewer connections required a toilets the owner of every house building and structure now erected and the owner of every house building and structure hereafter erected or acquired which may be occupied or used by human beings and is located on a street road avenue or other public thoroughfare and is located within three hundred 300 feet of any sanitary sewer now constructed or hereafter constructed in the township or to which sanitary sewer service is available shall within one hundred twenty 120 days after written notification install a toilet or toilets in such house building or structure unless a toilet or toilets are already installed therein and connect the sanitary sewage facilities emanating from such house building or structure to the sanitary sewerage system of the east greenwich township sewer department the township committee in its discretion may extend the time period for tying into the sewer system b industrial wastes if any such house building or structure referred to in subsection a of this section shall be used for industrial or commercial purposes the owner thereof within ninety 90 days of notice of sewer availability of such sanitary sewer to such house building or structure or prior to occupancy or use of such house building or structure whichever date shall be later shall install such facilities as are necessary to pretreat and convert the industrial wastes emanating therefrom into a form that may be treated by and is acceptable to the gloucester county utilities authority and the east greenwich township sewer department all industrial and commercial wastewaters must comply with all federal state county and local requirements c new connections where any house building or structure shall be completed on or after  and sanitary sewer services shall be available to it the same shall be connected to the township sanitary sewer system before its use or occupancy for any purpose d cesspools septic tanks and other private wastewater disposal facilities where any house building or structure is required to connect and when such connection is made to the sanitary sewerage system of the township in compliance with this chapter any existing cesspool seepage pit septic tanks and similar private wastewater disposal facility shall be cleaned of its contents and filled with suitable material and inspected by the gloucester county health officer and comply with all new jersey department of environmental protection abandonment and closure requirements to insure that no public health or safety hazards are in evidence e manual of rates rules and regulations the sewer department shall prepare adopt and publish a manual of rates rules and regulations for furnishing sanitary sewerage service in the township f failure to connect if the owner of any property in the township affected by the terms of this chapter shall fail and neglect to make any sanitary sewer connection or installation of pretreatment as herein provided the mayor and township committee by resolution may authorize proceedings in respect thereof and after giving notice as therein provided upon expiration of the period prescribed in and by such notice proceed to have the sanitary sewer connection made and installation of pretreatment made at the expense and cost of the property owner upon completion of the work the cost thereof including any charges by the township shall be certified to the township tax collector   prior code  10a1110a16   domestic service a new domestic customer service 1 charges as municipal lien as sewer charges are municipal liens all charges will be submitted by the sewer department prior to the date of settlement and verified in writing to the title company or whichever authorized agent is processing the transfer of property the title company shall be obligated to clear all sewer charges outstanding on the property in the event that charges are not paid at settlement those charges shall remain on the account as a lien against the property 2 search fee the township shall charge a search fee as set forth in schedule iii for sewer on each account search fees are due upon presentation failure on the part of the title company or the proper authorized agent to pay the search fees within twenty 20 days of presentation will result in the discontinuance of township lien information search fees will be charged for information in areas in which there is no existing sewer service 3 connection and other fees all connection and other fees shall be paid prior to any review of the plans by the department has certified that the sewer lateral systems have been installed in accordance with the township sewer departments rates rules and regulations 5 new fixtures under no circumstances shall any new fixture be installed in a building or dwelling at an elevation lower than the front curb elevation or the street centerline elevation whichever is higher the installation of an accessible check valve system with a gate valve between the check valve and the curb is mandatory for all customers requesting such new fixture installation to prevent surcharging of the new fixture installation from the sanitary sewer main because of high flow or blockage such installation is at the expense of the customer who is subsequently deemed owner of the installed facilities all customers are deemed to be responsible for its maintenance the township is indemnified and held harmless by the customer from any liability resulting from the malfunctioning of any fixture or required installation under this subdivision 6 initial billing date of newly constructed home the initial billing date of a newly constructed home will be the date of the certificate of occupancy or the date of settlement whichever is first b garbage disposals garbage disposals will be billed at an annual rate in addition to the normal sewer charge set forth in schedule ii charge for the disposal will continue until the customer has notified the township of the removal of the disposal and a house verification by the township has been made routine house inspections will be made by the township to determine the existence of garbage disposal systems and the customer will be billed for the disposal as of his or her last billing date preceding the inspection c landlordtenant responsibility all charges for sewer are a lien against the property and therefore the responsibility of the owner if the landlord requests in a letter that the bills be sent to the tenant the township at its discretion may oblige after informing the landlord that the final responsibility for any unpaid charges is the responsibility of the owner of the property and subsequent charges will be billed to the owner d discontinuation of customer service in the event that a sewer lateral service will be permanently discontinued the township shall be notified in writing that the service billing shall be terminated the sewer lateral shall be permanently sealed watertight in a manner subject to the approval of the township engineer or superintendent e inspection of riser cap when the township inspection indicates that a riser cap is missing or damaged the customer will be notified that the cap must be repaired or replaced within seven days after that time period the township will replace or repair the riser cap and the customer will be charged for parts and service a4   industrial service a application required industrial and commercial establishments making application for sanitary sewer service in addition to of the wastes the flow conditions which shall govern the conditions and costs with respect to the physical connection or connections and the annual service charges it will be the policy of the sewer department to consider each application on its merits and to establish specific conditions applicable to the particular situation for each agreement no connection shall be made prior to execution of the agreement all proposed industrial discharge must have the endorsement of the gloucester county utilities authority and comply with all of the authoritys industrial pretreatment requirements c of the sanitary sewer system if additional data is required after the initial review the applicant will be contacted to submit same to the township 3 fees a filing fee the filing fee shall be seventyfive dollars $7500 b review fee the review fee shall be five hundred dollars $50000 for the first five thousand 5000 square feet or any portion thereof and two hundred dollars $20000 for each additional five hundred 500 square feet or any portion thereof c inspection fee there shall be an inspection fee of five percent of the total sewer construction cost as verified by the township maximum and minimum rates of flow to be expected daily and seasonally  c flow diagram showing points of application of chemicals type and quantity of each chemical used per day and per shift a schedule of operations expected chemical characteristics of the untreated wastes and the point or points of connection to the sewerage system the normal situation will require the separation of and separate points of connection for domestic sewage and industrial wastes for each industrial establishment d prohibited wastes wastes containing the following substances or possessing the characteristics listed below will not be accepted 1 any septic tank or cesspool wastewater  2 any fluids with temperature in excess of one hundred ten 110 degrees fahrenheit  3 any fluid wastes which contain in excess of forty 40 mgl of fat oil grease either vegetable or mineral  4 any volatile explosive or flammable substance such as benzene gasoline naphtha fuel oil or similar substances  5 any solid or viscous matter which may cause any interference with the flow of wastes such as ashes cinders concrete sand mud straw shavings metal glass rags feathers tar plastics wood paunch manure hair or similar substances equipment or trucks carrying such materials shall not be washed and this water discharged into the system  6 any fluid wastes having a ph value less than 65 or in excess of 100 or possessing other properties capable of causing damage or hazard to sewers structures treatment process equipment or operating personnel  7 all wastewater constituents or characteristics prohibited by the gloucester county utilities authority  8 any noxious or malodorous gas or substance which is capable of causing a public nuisance  9 any radioactive substances  10 any wastes containing components which exceed limits set forth by the county state or federal regulatory agencies e grease oil and sand separators when in the reasonable opinion of the township engineer grease oil and sand interceptors or oil reclaimers are required they shall be provided and maintained at the expense of the owner in continuously efficient operating condition the owner will be required upon request to provide written verification or documentation that the units are being cleaned at a frequency acceptable to the township and to the gloucester county utilities authority grease and oil interceptors shall be constructed of impervious materials capable of withstanding abrupt and extreme changes in temperatures they shall be watertight substantially constructed and equipped with readily removable access covers where deemed necessary cold water sprays shall be installed the design and pertinent data shall be submitted to the township for review and approval prior to construction or installation separators must be constructed entirely on the property of the owner f pretreatment the township reserves the right to require pretreatment andor flow equalization where the chemical or flow characteristics of the proposed industrial wastes in the opinion of the township engineer or the gloucester county utilities authority or of state or federal agencies make such pretreatment or flow equalization desirable or mandatory some of the characteristics which may indicate pretreatment is needed are listed below 1 five day bod in excess of three hundred 300 mgl  2 suspended solids in excess of three hundred 300 mgl in such instances where it is agreed that the industrial waste will be received following pretreatment in accordance with the sewer use and pretreatment rules and regulations of the gloucester county utilities authority drawings and specifications shall be submitted for approval of the township engineer and the authority where pretreatment andor flow equalization facilities are required they shall be provided and continuously maintained in an effectively operating condition at all times at the expense of the industry each industry connected to the township sewer system shall be responsible for maintaining a quality of effluent from their premises which conform to the provisions established in their agreement with the township and in compliance with the sewer use and pretreatment rules and regulations of the gloucester county utilities authority the cost of preparing and submitting this data for consideration by the township shall be borne by the industry likewise the cost of sampling and analysis to determine compliance with the terms of the agreement shall be borne by the industry although conducted by the township or its duly authorized representative g control manhole industries permitted to connect to township sewers even though not initially being required to provide preliminary treatment may be required to provide a control manhole andor meter and sampler as described in subsection i of this section h violations and penalties in the event that any industry fails to conform to these regulations or fails to comply with the terms and conditions of their agreement with the township which failure causes damage of any sort to the townships sewer system or the townships employees the township reserves the right to cancel any agreement with the industry and terminate service to the industry the township shall determine the extent of the damage and bill the industry accordingly if such bill is not paid within thirty 30 calendar days from the date of the bill legal action may be instituted to enforce collection the township reserves the right to cancel the agreement upon ninety 90 days written notice in the event of repeated failure to comply with the terms of the agreement or the rates rules and regulations of the township i industrial waste flowmeter and sampler where deemed necessary by the township township shall give its consent and the township engineer shall approve contract plans and specifications therefore b auxiliary electrical power auxiliary electrical power is required for all motors used for pump stations and other motor driven equipment as determined by the township this shall apply to all major projects which major project is defined as including but not limited to major subdivisions general commercial projects and multiple occupancies in the excess of three domestic consumer units the township reserves the right to make exceptions to this requirement when it appears that the imposition thereof will be patently inequitable c connections residential subdivision containing four or more contiguous building sites or lots or any residential structure to be used by three or more families regardless of volume of flow and all nonresidential developments such as schools commercial buildings industrial buildings and all other structures will be required to install a sanitary sewer system to be connected to the nearest existing sanitary sewer in the township residential subdivisions containing three or less building sites or lots or if the lands are deemed by the township to be too remote from any existing facilities then consideration will be given to an individual sewage system with a dry sanitary sewer system for future use in lieu of connection to existing facilities individual sewage disposal systems will be permitted only upon specific written permission of the township and approval by the nj department of environmental protection such individual system plant or expansion of the location thereof shall be subject to approval by the township in accordance with the standards and requirements as hereinafter set forth any main extension and related facilities installed under the provisions of this section shall be transferred to the township as hereinafter described during construction but before final acceptance the township shall have the right to use any completed portion of the system without waiving its right to further inspection or testing or to order correction of any defects use of the sanitary sewer system for the discharge of section of the system until it is legally accepted by a township resolution a section is typically legally accepted after the completion of the final road surfacing when the sewer system received final inspection and approval from the township engineer 4 fees a filing fee there shall be a filing fee of fifty dollars $5000 b review fee an inspection and review fee of five percent of the total service line new connections to existing sewer mains will be at the expense of the applicant including tapping if approved by the township fittings pipe labor and related materials such new connections and laterals will become the property of the township to the curbline except when the sewer main is located in the sidewalk area then the townships ownership shall extend to the rightofway line the township will maintain such new connections and new laterals from the sewer main to the curbline or property line depending on the location of the sewer main after installation and approval by a representative of the township together with the township plumbing inspector the applicant will be fully responsible for street permits excavation and restoration and the complete cost thereof b size and kind of service lateral the township reserves the right to determine the size and kind of service lateral from the main to the vicinity of the curbline from the vicinity of the curbline to the property to be served or from the main in the rightofway to the property to be served laterals of all sizes shall be constructed of piping materials acceptable to the township a sketch showing the service lateral from the curb to the building including the sewer cleanout shall be furnished installed and maintained by the owner of the property a size fourinch lateral shall be laid at a minimum grade of onequarter inch per foot and in a straight line from the point of connection to the main where the main is in a rightofway or from the end of the township constructed service lateral to the structure to be served and where possible shall be at least four feet below the surface of the ground when final grading of the property has been completed that portion of the service lateral and sewer cleanout installed and maintained by the owner shall be installed in accordance with the township plumbing code and shall be inspected and approved by the township plumbing inspector prior to backfilling the trench any construction not approved shall be immediately removed and reconstructed in an approved manner c service lateral placement no service lateral shall be laid in the same trench with any gas pipe water service or any other facility of any public utility company nor within three feet of any open excavation vault or meter pit  nor shall the location be in conflict with any sidewalk or driveway all laterals shall be installed within the limits of the customers property and be a minimum of three feet from any property lines d elevation of sanitary fixtures under no circumstances shall any new sanitary fixtures be installed in a building at an elevation lower than the front curb elevation or street centerline elevation whichever is higher unless special precautions are incorporated into the new fixture installation to prevent surcharging of the new fixture from the sanitary sewer main because of high flows or blockage prior to installation of any fixture which may be lower than the elevation heretofore specified the owner shall obtain the approval of the township plumbing inspector on the type of precautions that will be taken to eliminate the potential flooding of premises with sewage in the event a fixture is found to be installed at any point lower than heretofore specified the township may revoke the sewer connection permit or discontinue service until the fixture is removed or positive control measures such as a gate valve and check valve are instituted to eliminate any potential surcharging of the building with sewage e maintenance by customer all connections service laterals sewer cleanouts and fixtures furnished by the customer shall be maintained by him or her in good order and all piping and connections furnished and owned by the township and on the property of the customer shall be protected properly and cared for by the customer all leaks in the service lateral or any other pipe or fixture in or upon the premises served must be repaired immediately by the owner or occupant of the premises the customer shall be responsible for notifying the township sewer department of the party engaged by the customer to do any maintenance work in the customers service lateral prior to work being commenced such party shall not backfill any trench until the work has been inspected and approved by the townships representative any work not acceptable shall be immediately removed and replaced by work which is acceptable no used or reclassified fittings shall be used in any sewer connection f responsibility of township the township shall in no way be responsible for maintaining any portion of the service lateral owned by the customer for damage done by sewage escaping therefrom or for lines or fixtures on the customers property  and the customer shall at all times comply with the applicable municipal regulations with respect thereto and make changes therein required by reason changes of grade relocation of mains or otherwise when there is no trap and vent installed between the curb and sidewalk area the property owner is responsible for service from his or her home to the sewer main g renewal of service lateral where the renewal of the service lateral from the main to the curb is found to be necessary the township will renew the service in the location as previously used if the property owner or customer for his or her own convenience desires the new service lateral at some other location and agrees to pay all expenses of such relocation in excess of the cost of laying the service lateral in the same location as previously used and cutting and disconnecting the old service lateral the township will lay the new service lateral at the location desired h prohibited connections under no circumstances will any of the following be connected to the sanitary sewers either directly or indirectly 1 foundation underdrains  2 floor drain area drain yard drain or drain from swimming pools  3 rain conductor or downspout  4 grease pit except when specifically authorized  5 air conditioning equipment except condensate which will be permitted under conditions approved by the township  6 stormwater inlets or catchbasins  7 drains and floor drains from pieces of equipment or manufacturing processes except when specifically authorized under the provisions of these rates rules and regulations i special connections service laterals to public buildings churches apartment houses commercial establishments and industrial establishments shall be installed to conform to detailed plans and specifications approved by the township engineer j special precautions in wet ground where groundwater is normally above the invert elevation of the service lateral the design and installation of the service lateral must have prior approval of the township engineer where the trench bottom is soft and yielding the township engineer reserves the right to require that the service be laid in partial or total concrete encasement junctions of two different types of pipe at the option of the township engineer may be required to be encased in concrete of mix determined by the township engineer k property served by single service lateral a service lateral from the vicinity of the curb or the main in a rightofway to a property shall not serve more than one property but any such property upon proper application of the owner may be served by two or more service laterals each of which for billing purposes shall be considered as being one customer account l single service lateral with two or more customers where two or more customers are now served single service lateral any violation of the rules of the township with respect to wither or any of such customers shall be deemed a violation as to all unless such violation is corrected after reasonable notice the township may take such action as may be taken until a customer who has not violated the townships rules has been given a reasonable opportunity to connect his or her pipe to a separately controlled service lateral m policy an blockages while the township has no responsibility beyond the curbline it will as a public service clear the curb cleanout at the request of the customer on his or her initial request the township will also verify that the portion of the service line between the curb and main is clear and when necessary take action to clear that section of the line determination of charges shall be as follows 1 if the curb cleanout is so positioned on the property that there is a distance between it and the curb the township may clear the line and if it is determined that the blockage was between the curb cleanout and the curb the township may charge the customer for clearing the blockage 2 if the customer requests that the township open the street to clear a blockage and the result of the excavation clearly indicates that the blockage is on the service line belonging to the customer the customer will be charged for the cost of the excavation and service 3 if a customer has no curb cleanout any blockage in the service line between the dwelling and the main shall be considered the responsibility of the customer n policy on missing or damaged curb cleanout caps when the township inspection indicates that a sewer cap is missing or damaged the customer will be notified that the cap must be repaired or replaced within seven days after that time period the township will replace or repair the cleanout cap and the customer will be charged for parts and service o unauthorized connection no unauthorized person shall uncover make any connection with or opening into use alter or disturb any public sewer service lateral or appurtenance thereof without first obtaining a written permit from the township p construction safeguards all excavations for service lateral installation shall be adequately guarded with barricades and lights so as to protect the public from hazard streets sidewalks parkways and other public property disturbed in the course of the work shall be restored in a manner satisfactory to the township a7   improper disposal of waste prohibited a purpose this section of the township of east greenwich code prohibits the spilling dumping or disposal of materials other than stormwater to the municipal separate storm sewer system ms4 operated by the township of east greenwich so as to protect public health safety and welfare and to prescribe penalties for the failure to comply b definitions for the purpose of this section the following terms phrases words and their derivations shall have the meanings stated herein unless their use in the text of this chapter clearly demonstrates a different meaning when not inconsistent with the context words used in the present tense include the future words used in the plural number include the singular number and words used in the singular number include the plural number the word shall is always a mandatory and not merely directory 1 municipal separate storm sewer system ms4 means a conveyance or a system of conveyances including roads with drainage systems municipal streets catch basins curbs gutters ditches manmade channels or storm drains that is owned or operated by the township of east greenwich or other public body and is designed and used for collecting and conveying stormwater 2 person means any individual corporation company partnership firm association or political subdivision of this state subject to municipal jurisdiction 3 stormwater means water resulting from precipitation including rain and snow that runs off the lands surface is transmitted to the subsurface is captured by separate storm sewers or other sewerage or drainage facilities or is conveyed by snow removal equipment c prohibited conduct the spilling dumping or disposal of materials other than stormwater to the municipal separate storm sewer system operated by the township of east greenwich is prohibited the spilling dumping or disposal of materials other than stormwater in such a manner as to cause the discharge of pollutants to the municipal separate storm system is also prohibited d exceptions to prohibition 1 waterline flushing and discharges from potable water sources 2 uncontaminated groundwater eg infiltration crawl space or basement sump pumps foundation or footing drain rising groundwaters 3 air conditioning condensate excluding contact and noncontact cooling water 4 irrigation water including landscape and lawn watering runoff 5 flows from springs riparian habitats and wetlands water reservoir discharges and diverted stream flows 6 residential car washing water and residential swimming pool discharging 7 sidewalk driveway and street wash water 8 flows from firefighting activities 9 flows from rinsing of the following equipment with clean water a beach maintenance equipment immediately following their use for their intended purposes  b equipment used in the application of salt and dicing materials immediately following salt and dicing materials applications prior to rinsing with clean water all residual salt and dicing materials must be removed from equipment and vehicles from the maximum extent practicable using dry cleaning methods eg shoveling and sweeping recovered materials are to be returned to storage for reuse or properly discarded rinsing of equipment as noted in the above situation is limited to exterior under carriage and exposed parts and does not apply to engines or other enclosed machinery e enforcement this section shall be enforced by the township of east greenwich police department building inspector or the public works manager f violations 1 any person who engages in unlawful conduct as defined in this section shall upon conviction thereof in a proceeding before a court of competent jurisdiction be subject to imprisonment in the county jail or in any place provided by the municipality for the detention of prisoners for any term not exceeding ninety 90 days  or by a fine the amount of which shall be a minimum of one hundred dollars $10000 up to a maximum of one thousand two hundred fifty dollars $125000  or by a period of community service not exceeding ninety 90 days or any combination thereof 2 any person who is convicted of violating the ordinance codified in this section within one year of the date of a previous violation of the same ordinance and who was fined for the previous violation shall be sentenced by a court to an additional fine as a repeat offender the additional fine imposed by the court upon a person for a repeated offense shall not be less than the minimum or exceed the maximum fine fixed for a violation of the ordinance codified in this section but shall be calculated separately from the fine imposed for the violation of this section    illicit connections to municipal sewer system prohibited a purpose this section of the township code part of the east greenwich township sewer department wastewater facilities any person violating this provision shall be subject to immediate arrest under a charge of disorderly conduct however in the alternative the township shall have the right to immediately charge the property owner the prevailing rate as if the property owner were connected to the system without regard to whether or not the actual connections were made including the gloucester county utilities authority user fees the township shall also be authorized to assess the property owner the prevailing connection fees and file any necessary documents to assure the payment of same a8   technical design standards a state standards all sanitary treatment and conveyance facilities shall be designed and constructed in strict accordance with the current edition of the nj department of environmental protection rules and regulations and the plumbing new jersey b minimum pipe cover all sanitary sewer building pipes shall be installed with a minimum of twentyfour 24 inches of cover in areas where the piping may be subjected to vehicular traffic however where cover is less than four feet ductile iron lined pipe shall be required c collection sewer extension pipe the following pipe materials may be used for design and construction of gravity collection sewer extensions in areas where normal ground conditions are anticipated or encountered the township reserves the right to require specific pipe materials joints and designs in the event that extraordinary ground conditions are anticipated or encountered the following types of pipe shall be permitted 1 reinforced concrete pipe  astm c76  min wall b class iv steel nring section o ring rubber gasket  2 cast iron pipe  astm a37766  class 22  3 ductile iron pipe  astm a37766  class 2  4 pvc pipe  astm d303473  required submittal of pipe sample to township  5 cast and ductile iron pipe shall be cement lined except when incorporated in a pipe network of pvc pipe in which case it shall be lined with coal tar epoxy with a minimum thickness of sixteen 16 millimeters d building sewer lateral pipe the following pipe materials may be used for design and sketch construction of building sewers or laterals 1 cast iron soil pipe  astm a 7472  2 pvc pipe  astm d303473  requires submittal of pipe sample to township for approval e raw sewage force main pipe the following pipe materials may be used for design and construction of raw sewage force mains the pipe material class and astm designation will depend on the specific characteristics of the project 1 cast iron pipe  2 ductile iron pipe  3 polyethylene pipe f manholes manhole design and construction shall be in accordance with the standard drawing details which are available from the sewer department concrete masonry manholes shall conform to astm c 13973 and precast manholes shall conform to c 47872 g other facilities pumping stations metering and sampling stations air relief and vacuum breaker chambers pretreatment facilities flow equalization facilities package treatment plants and other sewer facilities shall be designed and constructed subject to approval of the township based on the specific characteristics of each project h pipe installation all wastewater collection pipe installed in a slope flatter than  feet shall be laid under control of electronic devices i connection to existing force mains any connection to an existing township sanitary sewer force main shall comply with the following requirements 1 for pump stations serving two or more homes a licensed professional engineer must submit detailed design plans specifications and calculations showing the effect on existing township pump stations to the township engineer for review and approval 2 for individual homeowners a licensed plumber must submit a detailed design sketch showing location of tiein materials type and size of individual pump system to be installed for review and approval of the township engineer and superintendent 3 all force mains under existing roads shall be either ductile iron pipe or copper pipe 4 tieins to an existing force main shall be done using the wet tap method the connection shall be made using a full support service saddle to be approved by the township engineer and superintendent 5 the pump system for individual homes shall be designed to overcome the existing force main design conditions the homeowner is responsible for any required upgrades to their pump system for any future changes in the capacity or pressure of the township force main 6 the homeowner is responsible for complete installation of this system including all site and roadway restorations as previously noted in these rules and regulations 7 the homeowner is responsible for maintenance of the force main and pump system up to the curbline andor rightofway as previously noted in these rules and regulations a9   inspection and testing of installed facility a inspection of sewage system during construction all construction of sewage systems shall be under the jurisdictions of the township engineer either directly or under his or her supervision 1 the township engineer and the applicants engineer shall enforce compliance with the approved plans and specifications 2 the township engineer shall have the authority to have the work discontinued in the event of noncompliance 3 the applicant shall furnish the name of the occupant the street address and lot and block number to the township at least two weeks prior to a request for the certificate of occupancy from the building inspector in order that the lateral inspection can be accomplished 4 no sewer connections shall be made to the appropriate street main whether tested or not unless under the supervision and inspection of the representative of the township a temporary leakproof bulkhead type plug shall be installed in the upstream inlet side of the manhole furthest downstream in any sewer main or branch under construction and shall remain intact and unloosened until permission is received from the township to remove same the permission will not be granted until each section of the sewer has been cleaned and flushed in a manner acceptable to the township b testing of completed system all sewer mains shall be subjected to either an infiltration or exfiltration or low pressure air test and televised inspection with a copy of the tape and a written report given to the township exfiltration tests shall be conducted in lieu of infiltration tests when the pipe has been laid above the groundwater level infiltration tests shall be used only when the groundwater level is above the crown of the sewer and completely surrounds the pipe during the period of testing the tests shall be performed between two manholes or as otherwise directed by the township engineer and shall include all related sewerage including house connections the contractor shall furnish all labor materials and equipment necessary for the testing exfiltration tests shall be under at least a fourfoot head or a pressure corresponding to a head equal to the depth of the lower manhole or the section under the test allowable infiltration or exfiltration shall not exceed a rate of one hundred 100 gallons per mile per inch of diameter of sewer per twentyfour 24 hours in order to ensure that there shall be no gushing or spurting streams entering the sewer the contractor shall be held responsible for the watertightness of the line shall satisfactorily repair all joints and other parts not sufficiently watertight and then shall make additional tests of the infiltration or exfiltration until the test results conform to the requirements given herein a10   billing payment and delinquencies a rendering of bills for sewer service a single bill for sewer services will be rendered quarterly to each customer the bill will be printed the first of the month and rendered as soon thereafter as practicable sewer and garbage disposal charges are billed in advance for the quarter beginning with the billing date b payment schedule 1 late payment if a bill is not paid within thirty 30 days of the date of billing an interest rate of one and onehalf percent per month will be charged 2 disputed bill in the case of a disputed bill terminating substantially in favor of the customer the payment is due within ten days of the termination of the dispute c delinquent accounts 1 unpaid billsdiscontinuation of service any bill unpaid after thirty 30 days of presentation shall be classified as delinquent any bill unpaid after fortyfive 45 days of presentation shall be subject to discontinuance of service after not less than five days of written notice 2 signature of mayor all requests to the superintendent to shut off the service of a delinquent customer shall be over the signature of the mayor 3 restoration of service if service is discontinued for nonpayment of the account it will not be restored until the turn on fee payable in cash plus all unpaid charges are paid or satisfactory arrangements have been made for payment as set forth in schedule iii 4 return of checkprocessing fee if the check used as payment to prevent shut off of service is returned by the bank for insufficient funds a processing fee as set forth in schedule iii will be charged against the account and the service will be discontinued immediately without further notice subsequent payments by the customer must be in cash 5 unpaid balance as lien any unpaid balance of service charges and interest thereon shall be a line against the property and action shall be initiated pursuant to the procedures specified under njsa 1 et seq 6 notice of delinquent charges for publication notice of delinquent charges shall be given annually to the township tax collector thirty 30 days prior to the township posting notice of publishing all delinquent taxes d discontinuance of service service maybe discontinued at the sole discretion of the township for any of the following reasons 1 misrepresentation in application  2 wilful waste of water or imperfect pipes fixtures or otherwise  3 use of sewer for any other property or purpose than that described in the application  4 destruction or damage to any service pipe or any other appliance of the township  5 nonpayment of any charge accruing under the application  6 refusal of reasonable access to the property for purposes of inspecting reading repairing or removing meters andor plumbing  7 making or refusing to sever any cross connection between a pipe or fixture furnished by the township and a pipe or fixture from any other source  8 nonpayment of bills within the time prescribed  9 violation of any rules of the township e renewal service service will be renewed when the conditions under which such service was disconnected are corrected and upon payment of all accrued charges provided in the schedule of rates or rules of the township f deposits 1 deposits may be required from any customer who becomes habitually delinquent the amount of the deposit shall be equal to his or her average quarterly bill 2 any customer having paid a deposit shall pay bills for sewer service as rendered in accordance with the rates rules and regulations of the township the deposit shall not be considered as payment on account of a bill during the time the customer is receiving service 3 deposits shall be returned to the depositor when he or she shall have paid undisputed bills for service for a period of twelve 12 consecutive months 4 no interest will be paid on deposits g continuing obligation to pay service charge upon connection of an improved and usable property to a sewer the obligation to pay the minimal annual service charge continues despite the failure to occupy the property or to use the sewer facilities so long as the building or structure on the property is still available for use and the sewer facilities remain available a11   responsibility for service a assumption of good condition when a prospective customer has made application for a new service or has applied for reinstatement of an existing service it shall be presumed that the piping and fixtures on the applicants premises are in good condition the township will not be liable in any event for any accident breaks or leakage arising in any way in connection with the freezing of pipes or fixtures of the customer nor any damage to the property which may result from the usage b complaints complaints with respect to the character of service furnished or of the bills rendered must be made at the township building either orally or in writing and a record of such complaint will be kept by the township noting the name and address of the complainant the date the nature of the complaint and the remedy c reasonable access the properly identified authorized agents of the township shall have the right of access to the premises served at all reasonable hours for the purpose of reading meters collecting samples examining fixtures and pipes observing the manner of use and for any other purpose which is proper and necessary in the conduct of the township business d no oral agreements no agent or employee of the township has authorization to orally bind it by any promise agreement or representation not provided for in these rates rules and regulations e damage repairs and discharges 1 damage and repairs whenever any person causes or has caused any damage to the sewer system or facilities of the township the party or parties causing the damage shall immediately notify the township of such damage the township shall have the right to repair such damage or have such damage repaired and shall have the further right to recover the full cost and expense of such repairs including but not limited to the standard charges for work performed by township employees for materials supplies and equipment used for such repairs from the party or parties causing such damage 2 discharges the discharge of any surface or subsurface water directly or indirectly to the sanitary sewer system is prohibited underdrain systems for the foundation of buildings shall be connected to a storm drainage system or natural outlet approved by the township engineer further underdrain systems in municipal rightsofway shall have separate cleanouts which shall not be in any appurtenance of the sanitary sewer system f mandatory sewer connection the owner of any property located along the line of any sewer in the township on which a house or building was then or shall thereafter be erected shall connect such house or building to the sewer line as required by the township if such owner shall fail to do so the township shall take all appropriate action including legal action to compel compliance a12   schedule of rates for domestic wastewater all sewer customers shall have a minimum charge of three hundred dollars $30000 per vision such as the widest diameter of a visual field subtends an angle no greater than twenty 20 degrees shall be considered as having a central visual acuity of 20200 or less    enforcement of and regulations on file three copies of the subcodes and rules and regulations promulgated by the commissioner of the new jersey department of community affairs pursuant to njsa d119 et seq are filed in the office of the department of inspections of the township    purpose of construction and demolition debris diversion program the purpose of this section is to establish the construction and demolition debris diversion deposit program this program is intended to increase the diversion of construction and demolition debris from landfill disposal conserve the capacity and extend the useful life of landfills and avoid the potential financial and other consequences to the township of failing to timely meet new jersey department of environmental protection requirements    definitions all defined terms in this section appear in italics and are found in sections of this except for the terms building permit and demolitionremoval permit which refer to those terms respectively as used in this which consistent with the are not italicized in this article in addition whenever the following words or phrases are used in this article they mean approved recycling facility means a recycling composting materials recovery or reuse facility which accepts construction and demolition debris and which is an approvedlicensed njdep class ad recycling center or a recognized facility by the recycling coordinator construction and demolition debris means the waste building materials packaging and rubble resulting from construction remodeling repair alteration andor demolition operations on pavements houses all residential and nonresidential developments and other structures and may include but is not limited to concrete asphalt wood metals bricks block masonry wallboard dirt rocks landscape waste and other inert waste disposal means the final depositing of solid waste other than construction and demolition debris at a permitted landfill or facility diversion or divert means the reduction or elimination of solid waste from landfill disposal njdep is the new jersey department of environmental protection recycling coordinator means the recycling coordinator of the township and its successor solid waste means all putrescible and nonputrescible solid semisolid and liquid wastes including but not limited to garbage trash refuse paper rubbish ashes industrial wastes construction and demolition debris abandoned vehicles and parts thereof discarded home and industrial appliances dewatered treated or chemically fixed sewage sludge which is not hazardous waste manure vegetable or animal solid and semisolid wastes and other discarded solid and semisolid wastes solid waste does not include hazardous waste hazardous substances or medical wastes as those terms are defined in state or federal law waste management form part i means the form prepared by the recycling coordinator on which an applicant for a building permit or demolitionremoval permit shall provide information including but not limited to the types and amounts of construction and demolition debris the applicant anticipates each buildingdemolition permit application will generate and the expected construction and demolition debris diversion the applicant expects to achieve for that permitted action waste management form part ii means the form prepared by the recycling coordinator on which the applicant for a building permit or demolitionremoval permit shall provide information including but not limited to the documentary evidence in a form satisfactory to the recycling coordinator demonstrating the construction and demolition debris diversion the applicant achieved for the development    submittal of waste management form and diversion deposit a except as otherwise provided in this article all applicants for a building permit or a demolitionremoval permit including the township shall submit a properly completed waste management form part i with the building permit or demolitionremoval permit application in accordance with the requirements set forth in this no building permit or demolitionremoval permit shall be issued unless the applicant has submitted a properly completed waste management form part i    construction and demolition debris measurement and rates a construction and demolition debris shall be measured by weight or by volume whichever is most accurate and practicable to the extent practicable all construction and demolition debris shall be weighed on a scale 1 for construction and demolition debris which is weighed the applicant shall use a scale which is in compliance with all federal state and local regulatory requirements for accuracy and maintenance of such scale 2 for construction and demolition debris for which measurement by weight is not practicable the applicant shall measure by volume and convert the volumetric measurements to weight using the standardized rates established in the township construction and demolition debris conversion rate tables 3 the recycling coordinator reserves the right when appropriate to establish standard weights for various types of construction and demolition debris items based upon accepted average weights for such items these standard weights shall be listed in the township construction and demolition debris conversion rate tables 4 all proof showing satisfactory diversion of construction and demolition debris must be submitted on a yearly basis calendar year or at the end of the project whichever is sooner b for building permits or demolitionremoval permits issued on or after the effective date of this article the diversion rate shall be sixtyfive 65 percent by weight of the total construction and demolition debris generated by the development 1 if there are no operating approved recycling facilities or recognized facilities available for the diversion of construction and demolition debris  the applicant shall notify the recycling coordinator for verification in writing via certified mail    approved recycling facilitiescenters a recycling centersfacilities utilized must be one of the following 1 an approved class ad facility per the njdep  2 a facility approved or recognized by the njdep or recycling coordinator a the recycling coordinator will keep a list of such facilities on file at the township offices    diversion program exemptions government buildings or other similar structures   prior code 931   means of identification a measurement each digit shall be at least three inches in height by one and onehalf inches in width b display all numbers shall be prominently displayed so as to be visible from the street c material the numbers shall be of a durable material such as metal plastic glass or paint of contrasting color 2   numbering system a all buildings on the south side or east side of a street shall be identified with odd numbers b all buildings on the north side or west side of a street shall be identified with even numbers c the northernmost point of kings highway where the township borders west deptford township shall be identified with the lowest number and the numbers shall go to the next highest number in a southerly direction along kings highway to a point where the township borders woolrich township d all streets that cross kings highway and bear the same name on both sides shall hereinafter be designated east or west before the name and shall be separate and distinct streets e where a street crosses kings highway those buildings immediately to the south of that intersection on kings highway shall be identified by the next 100 series of numbers and shall continue in the next 100 series until intersecting the next succeeding street that crosses kings highway a street that intersects kings highway to only the east or west but does not cross shall not cause the next 100 series to be used f any street within the township running parallel with kings highway shall be identified as nearly as practical with the same 100 series as used on kings highway at that point g any building on a street running east or west from kings highway shall be so numbered that each block will be in the next 100 series with the first 100 series beginning at a point where the street intersects kings highway h any building on a street running east or west that does not begin by intersecting kings highway shall be numbered as nearly as practical by using the same 100 series as a street paralleling such street   prior code  933   issuance of numbers a at the time of issuing a certificate of occupancy the additions insertions deletions and changes if any prescribed herein  development fees for low and moderate income housing   purpose in holmdel builders assn vs holmdel township 121 nj 550 1990 the new jersey supreme court determined that mandatory development fees are authorized by the fair housing act of 198 njsa d301 et seq and the state constitution subject to coah developing rules the purpose of this chapter is to establish standards for the collection maintenance and expenditure of development fees pursuant to coahs rules fees collected pursuant to this chapter shall be used for the sole purpose of providing low and moderate income housing this chapter shall be interpreted within the framework of coahs rules on development fees  2002  2002   residential and nonresidential development fees within all residential zoning districts developers shall pay a development fee of one percent of the equalized assessed value of any eligible residential activity pursuant to this chapter within all nonresidential zoning districts developers shall pay a development fee of two percent for any eligible nonresidential activity pursuant to this chapter   2002  2002   eligible exaction ineligible exaction and exemptions a developers of low and moderate income units shall be exempt from paying development fees b developers which expand an existing structure except owneroccupied residential structures shall pay a development fee the development fee shall be calculated based on the increase in the equalized assessed value of the improved structure c developers that have received preliminary or final approval prior to  shall be exempt from paying a development fee unless the developer seeks a substantial change in the approval      collection of fees all such development fees must be paid in full prior to the issuance of a certificate of occupancy or certificate of approval as the case may be for nonresidential activity no such certificate of occupancy or certificate of approval may be issued before such fees shall be paid in full to the cfotreasurer of east greenwich township   2002  2002   housing trust fund a there is hereby created an interest bearing housing trust fund at the bank of gloucester county for the purpose of receiving development fees from residential developers all development fees paid by developers pursuant to this chapter shall be deposited in this fund no money shall be expended from the housing trust fund unless the expenditure conforms to a spending plan approved by coah b if coah should determine that east greenwich township be not in conformance with coahs rules on development fees coah is authorized to direct the manner in which all development fees collected pursuant to this chapter shall be expended such authorization is pursuant to this chapter coahs rules on development fees and the written authorization from the governing body to the bank of gloucester county  2002  2002   use of funds a money deposited in a housing trust fund may be used for any activity approved by coah for addressing east greenwich townships low and moderate income housing obligation such activities may include but are not necessarily limited to housing rehabilitation new construction regional contribution agreements the purchase of land for low and moderate income housing extensions andor improvements of roads and infrastructure to low and moderate income housing sites assistance designed to render units to be more affordable to low and moderate income people and administration costs necessary to implement the master plans housing element the expenditure of all money shall conform to a spending plan approved by coah b at least thirty 30 percent of the revenues collected shall be devoted to render units more affordable examples of such activities include but are not limited to down payment assistance low interest loans and rental assistance c no more than twenty 20 percent of the revenue shall be expended on administration costs necessary to develop revise or implement the housing element examples of eligible administrative activities include personnel consultant services space costs consumable supplies and rental or purchase of equipment d development fee revenue shall not be expended to reimburse east greenwich for housing activities that preceded substantive certification  2002  2002   definitions coah means the new jersey council on affordable housing development fees means money paid by an individual person partnership association company or corporation for the improvement of property as permitted in coahs rules equalized assessed value means the value of a property determined by the municipal tax assessor process designed to ensure that all property in the municipality is assessed at the same assessment ratio or ratios required by law estimates at the time of building permit may be obtained by the tax assessor utilizing estimates for construction cost final equalized assessed value will be determined at project completion by the municipal tax assessor judgment of repose means a judgment issued by the superior court approving a municipalitys plan to satisfy its fair share obligation substantive certification means a determination by the council approving a municipalitys housing element and fair share plan in accordance with the provisions of the act and the rules and criteria as set forth herein a grant of substantive certification shall be valid for a period of six years in accordance with the terms and conditions contained therein  2002  2002 swimming pools   swimming pool defined as used in this chapter swimming pool means and includes fill and draw flowrecirculation pools outdoor and indoor which are artificially constructed to provide recreational facilities for swimming bathing or wading and shall include both public and private pools and shall also include pools served by natural outdoor ponds rivers or lakes it shall not include natural outdoor ponds rivers or lakes 1   permit required no person shall construct or maintain upon any premises within the township any swimming pool unless he or she has first applied to the building inspector and obtained a permit to do so pursuant to the provisions of this chapter any other applicable ordinance 2   application information the application for a permit shall be accompanied by duplicate plans specifications and the plot plan of the property the plot plan shall show the accurate location of the proposed pool on the property as well as the location height and type of all existing or proposed fencing including the type or height of fencing or enclosure required by this chapter the application shall also show the means of filling and emptying the pool the physical chemical and bacterial quality of the pool water and the means by which it is to be maintained 3   fee applicants shall pay a fee as provided in e to the township for a swimming pool permit which permit fee shall be exclusive of the permit fee required for erection of any accessory structure to be used in connection with the swimming pool 4   granting of permit no permit for a swimming pool shall be issued by the building inspector unless the plans specifications and plot comply with this chapter and all other applicable ordinances of the township and unless and until the applicant has presented to the building inspector a certificate from the board of health certifying that the plans for the pool comply with any ordinances rules or regulations of the board of health then in effect 5   suspension or revocation any swimming pool permit shall be conditional upon continued compliance by the permittee with all provisions of this chapter and other applicable ordinances of the township or of the board of health any such permit may be suspended for a period not exceeding five days and thereafter revoked following notice and hearing on such suspensions for violations of any of the provisions of this chapter or any other applicable ordinance of the township or the board of health upon revocation the permittee or owner of the ground whereon the pool is located shall forthwith take such effective steps to close the pool and to prevent intentional or accidental access thereto as the township committee shall direct initial suspension may be by the building inspector but final revocation or suspension after hearing shall be by the township committee 6   location the location of any swimming pool shall comply with all applicable provisions of the zoning ordinance in addition thereto a swimming pool shall not be constructed installed located maintained or operated within six feet of any property line nor nearer to any street line upon which the property abuts than the existing setback line for structures erected on such property but in no case less than fifteen 15 feet from a street line 7    fence required every swimming pool shall be completely surrounded by a fence or wall of suitable construction not less than four feet in height which shall be so constructed so as not to have openings holes or gaps larger than two inches in dimension except for doors and gates if a picket fence is erected or maintained the horizontal dimension shall not exceed four inches a dwelling house or accessory building may be used as part of the enclosure a design requirements the fence or wall enclosure shall be so designed and constructed as to reasonably prevent any person from gaining access beneath over the same and shall he provided with one or more substantial gates or doors of the same height as the fence or wall enclosure b gates and doors every gate or door opening enclosure shall be equipped with a selfclosing and selflatching device capable of keeping such gate or door securely closed the gate or door shall be locked so as to prevent unauthorized access to the pool 8   lights lights used to illuminate any swimming pool or bathing pool shall be so arranged and shaded as to reflect light away from adjoining premises electrical fixtures and the wiring and installation thereof used in connection with the swimming pool shall conform to the standards of the national board of fire underwriters for electrical wiring and apparatus 9   sanitary regulations swimming pools shall be subject to any sanitary regulations of the township board of health or hereafter enacted by the board of health 10 soil removal   short title this chapter may be known and may be cited as the east greenwich township soil removal premises 2 no owner of any premises in the township shall cause allow permit or suffer any excavation for or removal of soil from such premises for sale or for use other than on the premises from
